en: Woe to the bloody city! it is all full of lies and rapine; the prey departeth not.
hmr: Thisen insuo hmang khawpui chu a chung a rik ie! Khêl le inrawk- nain a sip vawng a; an sase chu a chatlak nawh.

en: The noise of the whip, and the noise of the rattling of wheels, and prancing horses, and bounding chariots,
hmr: Vuokna vai rîk dâm, tawlailîr ke innghawr ri dâm, sakawr inchâwm dâm, tawlailîr tlân tlut tlut dâm leh;

en: the horseman mounting, and the flashing sword, and the glittering spear, and a multitude of slain, and a great heap of corpses, and there is no end of the bodies; they stumble upon their bodies;—
hmr: sakawr chung chuong mi, sakawr- a chuong dâm, kâwlhnâm tle zawr zawr dâm, fei tle pawp pawp dâm le, mi that um rem rum dâm, ruong um rei rui dâm leh; ruong chu tâwp ti hrim a nei nawh, an ruong haia chun an insui a;

en: because of the multitude of the whoredoms of the well-favored harlot, the mistress of witchcrafts, that selleth nations through her whoredoms, and families through her witchcrafts.
hmr: chuong chu, nawchizawr hmêl ṭha, dawithiemnu, a uiretna leia hnam zawr a, dawi chîngna leia sûngkuo zawrtu uiretna nasatak leia hung um a nih.

en: Behold, I am against thee, saith Jehovah of hosts, and I will uncover thy skirts upon thy face; and I will show the nations thy nakedness, and the kingdoms thy shame.
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA chun hieng ang hin a tih, Ngai ta, ka do che a nih; i hmai tieng i puon hlîm ka ta; i saruokna hnamhai kuoma le i muol- phona lal ramhai kuomah inentir ka tih.

en: And I will cast abominable filth upon thee, and make thee vile, and will set thee as a gazing-stock.
hmr: Hmunhnawk tirdakumtakin thêng ka ti cheh a, inzakumtakin siem ka ti che a, ennuom dingin sieng ka ti che.

en: And it shall come to pass, that all they that look upon thee shall flee from thee, and say, Nineveh is laid waste: who will bemoan her? whence shall I seek comforters for thee?
hmr: Chun, hieng ang hi hung nîng a ta, a hmu taphawt che chu i kuoma inthawkin tlân hmang an tih. Ninevi khuo chu a hung tâwp tah a nih; tuin am sûn a ta? Khâwlaia inthawkin am i ta dingin lungmuongna ei zawng ding chu aw! tîng an tih.

en: Art thou better than No-amon, that was situate among the rivers, that had the waters round about her; whose rampart was the sea, and her wall was of the sea?
hmr: Vadunghai kâra um, No-amon, a vêla tuiin ân huol, a kul dinga tui- pui hmanga, a kul bang ding tui- pui nei nêk khan i ṭha lem am a nih?

en: Ethiopia and Egypt were her strength, and it was infinite; Put and Lubim were thy helpers.
hmr: Ethiopia le Aigupta chu a hrâtna a na, chu chu tâwp chin nei lo a nih; Put le Lubim chu nangma ṭhangpui- tuhai an nih.

en: Yet was she carried away, she went into captivity; her young children also were dashed in pieces at the head of all the streets; and they cast lots for her honorable men, and all her great men were bound in chains.
hmr: Chuong sa khawm chun lâk hmangin a um a, salah ân tâng a: kawtthlêr tin tâwpah a naupangtehai chu an pei nawipêk a; a mi ṭhahai ta dingin ai an sân a, a mi lienhai po po chu khaidieta khuop an nih.

en: Thou also shalt be drunken; thou shalt be hid; thou also shalt seek a stronghold because of the enemy.
hmr: Nang khawm inrui bawk i ta, thuphmangin um i tih; hmêlma leiin kul det zawng bawk i tih.

en: All thy fortresses shall be like fig-trees with the first-ripe figs: if they be shaken, they fall into the mouth of the eater.
hmr: I kul po po chu theichang kûng, ra hmin hmasa put ang nîng an ta, an inhnîng phawt chun a fatu bauah an tla lût hlak.

en: Behold, thy people in the midst of thee are women; the gates of thy land are set wide open unto thine enemies: the fire hath devoured thy bars.
hmr: Ngai ta, i sûnga i mipuihai chu nuhmei an na, i hmêlmahai ta dingin i ram kawtkhâr chu ân hawng huoi a, în kalna thîr tluonhai chu meiin a kâng hmang a nih.

en: Draw thee water for the siege; strengthen thy fortresses; go into the clay, and tread the mortar; make strong the brickkiln.
hmr: Inhuol vêla i um sûnga dingin tui chawi la, i kulhai sukdet rawh; pilpawk umnaa chun fe la, lung chârna chu chîl la, ṭêklei râwna thuk chu sukdet rawh.

en: There shall the fire devour thee; the sword shall cut thee off; it shall devour thee like the canker-worm: make thyself many as the canker-worm; make thyself many as the locust.
hmr: Chutaka chun meiin kâng hmang a ti cheh a, kâwlhnâmin sât hlum a ti che, khâu angin sukbohmang a ti che: khâu angin insukpung la, khâuhawn angin insukpung rawh.

en: Thou hast multiplied thy merchants above the stars of heaven: the canker-worm ravageth, and fleeth away.
hmr: I sumdâwngtuhai chu vâna ara- sihai nêka tamin i sukpung a, khâu chun a suksiet a, a vuong hmang el hlak.

en: Thy princes are as the locusts, and thy marshals as the swarms of grasshoppers, which encamp in the hedges in the cold day, but when the sun ariseth they flee away, and their place is not known where they are.
hmr: I mi lallukhum khumhai chu khâuhawn ang an na, i sipai hotuhai chu khaw dei nia khâu ruol pala fu khâwm ang an nih, amiruokchu, nisa a hung suok a, an vuong hmang a, an umna hmun hrim hriet a ni nawh.

en: Thy shepherds slumber, O king of Assyria; thy nobles are at rest; thy people are scattered upon the mountains, and there is none to gather them.
hmr: Aw Assuria lal, i berâm vêngtu- hai chu an inlusu ie, i mi lienhai chu an châwl a, i mipuihai chu tlânghaia chun an indar zo a, ṭhuoi khâwmtu tukhawm an um nawh.

en: There is no assuaging of thy hurt; thy wound is grievous: all that hear the report of thee clap their hands over thee; for upon whom hath not thy wickedness passed continually?
hmr: I na chu a damna ding a um nawh, i hliemna chu a nasa hle a nih; i ri hre taphawt chun kut an ben- khum che; i rîtlona hin a chîm rawp naw tu am a um a?
